title: Administrative Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Richmond, KY)
Interview Descriptions: Was on zoom... it was the best interview ever! Friendliest people! So glad to have interviewed with EKU!! Then a background check was completed. Week or so later, I went into HR and filled out paperwork!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Basic interview questions.

title: Assistant Online Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: Two stages of interviews. Initial interview and final interview. Very polite committee and easy to speak with. Primarily focused on explaining position and asked questions on experience in different situations.
Interview Questions: Explain experience working with faculty.

title: Resident Advisor (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: Very simple process. Basic questions. I think there was a phone interview and then in person interview. Many of the questions are the same as the application. If you're already an RA and are just trying to go back, then you just have a short interview with your RHC
Interview Questions: How would you handle a high stress situation?

title: Quality Control Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: Moderate interview. It was not very difficult interview. There will be around 2 rounds in the interview process. one would be technical and other would be behavioral type of questions.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about this position?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I was selected for an interview with the search committee. After the first round, I was offered a second interview later that week. It was very short notice, but I accomodated. I met with the hiring committee and the dean for the second interview. 

After my interview, I was ghosted. This is really appaling since these are colleagues that I will see again at conferences every year. I never received any follow up whatsoever. The way I was treated was unacceptable, and I will never recommend EKU to anyone after my experience.  After the unprofessional way EKU conducted themselves, I accepted a TT offer elsewhere.
Interview Questions:
Standard academic questions: 

Tell us about your research and teaching? 
How do you implement inclusive teaching practices? 
What classes would you be able /willing to teach?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: You walk into a room and are interviewed by a current RA as well as either an RHC or GRHC. The questions have a lot to do with the leadership seminar, so it should be simple.
Interview Questions: Q: What is a time that you demonstrated good leadership?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very fast. Less than 24 hours notice. Why was not fast was the notification of selection. In fact to this day no call or email has been sent notifying me of someone else getting the job.
Interview Questions: What do you see as success a year into this role?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fairly short, very casual and laid back. There were two people in my interview who asked questions. They were both very friendly. They got back to me fairly quickly about their decision, which I appreciate. It was about a week or so after the interview.
Interview Questions: What do you think your strengths are?

title: Senior Accounting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel review from multiples Senior staff members. They took turns asking me questions and the questions ranged from anecdotal based on prior work experience to hypothetical accounting problems. I was brought back for a second panel before being given a job offer
Interview Questions: To describe my best and worst qualities

title: Associate Director of Facilities and Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Richmond, KY) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied for this job eight months before I heard anything back.  They emailed me and asked to set up a phone interview.  Then, moved on to the in-person interview.  Met with three different committees and discussed everything about how to change the operations and facilities for the dorms.  I was given a tour of the facilities and shown what was wrong with the facilities and the work order system.
Interview Questions: They asked me about how I planned to solve the lack of motivation for the facilities team.  Also, asked me about how I planned to solve the issue surrounding the age and problems within the dorms.

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University
Interview Descriptions: Standard day and a half faculty interview with campus stakeholders & presentation. I was reimbursed for expenses, although I stayed with family in a nearby city. EKU folks ask pointed questions, and the interview process is definitely two-way. It's important to do your homework and ask questions of your interviewers. There are some really nice dining spots in Richmond.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this area?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Lexington-Fayette, KY)
Interview Descriptions: Several phone interview and a face-to-face interview. I had a basic phone interview which was then followed by a semi-detailed phone interview. After "passing" the two interviews I had a face-to-face interview with the Mayors Office and a EKU official. I was then offered the position the following day.
Interview Questions: What aspect of marketing is the most important?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Richmond, KY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process involved submitting an application and waiting for a phone interview. After the phone interview, it was the typical on campus interview.  The only issue was finding a time to meet with the committee as the interview was delayed due to weather which made finding an acceptable time difficult.
Interview Questions: Describe my classroom interactions.

title: Geek Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Richmond, KY) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I sat down with the manager of the program, although senior members conduct interviews on occasion.  The setting was in the most casual computer lab just after lunch.  While I was applying for an IT related position, the one conducting the interview was not trained in IT, so I had to do more explaining that otherwise.

Overall, the process was not one that is worth getting nervous about, and designed to create a relaxing experience for the prospective employee.
Interview Questions: What is one thing that you failed at, and how did you learn from that experience?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Richmond, KY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, I had been a student at the university for 4 years and my employer already knew who I was and my work ethic. They offered me the job going into grad school, which was nice.
Interview Questions: Do you want the job?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Richmond, KY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application online after being referred by an employee during a meeting on campus. I was contacted the next day, and an interview was scheduled for the following week. The interview lasted approximately thirty minutes, and the interviewer predominantly focused on questions having to do with my academic progress, and campus involvement.
Interview Questions: How do you stay involved on campus?

title: Chemistry Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Richmond, KY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy to access jobs and apply on website. Took a while to hear about an interview. Slow hiring process from HR. Parking was difficult to figure out. Interviewers and other employees that I was introduced to were very kind.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Richmond, KY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: HR recruiter conducted a phone and face-to-face pre-screen interview for the Research Assistant position.  I was then scheduled for a on-site, face-to-face interview with this department chair.  The final decision was made by the department chair following my drug test and background check by the HR department.
Interview Questions: Availability and former employment questions

title: Support Services Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Richmond, KY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I put in close to 16 application, and could not even get but one interview. I feel it was jsut an interview to please me, or make me feel I had a chance, but I left there knowing I did not have a chance. I want to move to Berea, but cannot get a job.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question and unexpected question was If I could be trusted with a secret.  Of course I am trustworthy.

title: Library Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Eastern Kentucky University (Richmond, KY) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: I met with 3 supervisors from the department. They asked the usual quesitons.  Within two weeks I was hired and started work.
Interview Questions: What would you consider your biggest weakness?
